result.execSummary:
The defendant Eltag A Abusam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eltag A Abusam is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eltag A Abusam was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May Not have contact withTamaika Benson, Lazeric Maxey or Juwon Brown.  Maintain stable residence.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Jerold Breitenbach.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Second Amended Information filed, amending the maximum penalty re repeater.
Count 1 -Total length of sentence:  6 years.
Initial term of confinement:  3 years WSP, credit for 430 days served.
Length of extended supervision:  3 years w/conditions.
Def. is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Progarm.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Defendant, Eltag A Abusam appeared with Atty Jerold Breitenbach    Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Heard with cases of co-defendants 14CF1263/14CF1262.    Motion to sever by Atty Breitenbach is reviewed by use of the transcript from last hearing. State concedes cases servered at last hearing are 14CF1261 and 14CF1262.   State asks that all DE's submit a buccal swab today; all attorneys stipulate to having the swab taken and submitted.  Atty Ekes in case 14CF1262 will submitting a speedy trial demand.   Atty Breitenbach's motion to reduce bond for Eltag Abusam in case 14CF1261 to a signature bond.  Arguments heard.   Bond motion denied by the Court. records.addlTxt: Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Def. Lazeric Maxey appeared with Atty. Andrea Rufo; Def. Eltag Abusam appeared with Atty. Jerold Breitenbach; Def. Dashai Brown-Young appeared with Atty. Brett Ekes; Def. Juwon Brown appeared with Atty. David Celebre. Clerk LE. Preliminary hearings held jointly in 14CF1260/14CF1261/14CF1262/14CF1263. KPD Det. Daniel DeJong sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Breitenbach. Cross-examination by Atty. Celebre. Cross-examination by Atty. Rufo. Cross-examination by Atty. Ekes. Probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Attys. Rufo, Breitenbach, Ekes, and Celebre. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 1-13-15 @ 8:30am with co-defs. Bond continued.
Scheduling Order
of Judge Schroeder filed by Attys. Rufo, Breitenbach, Ekes, and Celebre, attorneys for all four co-defendants. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman.
